title: Senior Engineer-Network and Security For Quatrro/Mumbai_Night Shift
tagsAndSkills: SDWAN,L3,PCNSE,Velo cloud & Cisco Meraki,Cisco Meraki,VMware,Cisco ACS,Palo Alto Firewall
jobDescription:
Role & responsibilities

Essential functions and responsibilities (but not limited to):

  • Create presentations outlining findings and present to the client managers and

engineers.

  • Switching technology VLAN, VXLAN, VTP, VSS – Cisco Catalyst platform, Nexus, HP

and Juniper, SDLAN

  • Routing – Routing protocols, configuration and Troubleshooting traditional WAN and

SDWAN – Velo cloud & Cisco Meraki

  • Firewalls – Sound knowledge on Virtual firewalls, Cisco ASA, Checkpoint, Palo Alto NG

firewalls.

  • Sound Knowledge on Wireless technology
  • Basic understanding on Link load balancers, Server Load balancers and Data Center

device management & implementation.

  • Work with clients to develop network engineering solutions from concept through

implementation.

  • Assist in development of network detailed designs in the following areas: software

defined networking, network segmentation, network access control, network security

and cloud networking components.

  • Analyze and provide recommendations for emerging network technologies.
  • Understanding Support priorities and objectives and taking an active role in

accomplishing them.

  • Working Knowledge on Network security Protocols, LAN, WAN, Network security,

Wireless networks, DHCP, DNS, Proxy, VPN, Firewalls, TCP/IP, Intranets, Extranets,

VoIP, Virtualization, High Availability, Backups/Disaster recovery, Routers, Device drivers.

  • Deployment and configuration of various network devices and services, including SD-

WAN, Load Balancers, Routers, Switches, IPS/IDS, Wireless LAN, VPN, MPLS, Radius,

and MFA.

  • Providing Level 2/Level 3 support and troubleshooting to resolve issues.
  • Providing Support to Level 1 and Level 2 Engineers.
  • Handling Customer escalations and taking ownerships.
  • Providing RCA and Cases analysis whenever required.
  • Preparing Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly reports and share with the Upper management

and Clients.

  • Knowledge of Managing Virtual networks on cloud platforms e.g., Azure, Google Cloud,

AWS and VM Ware.

  • Performing network maintenance and system upgrades including service packs, patches,

hot fixed and security configurations.


  • Monitoring performance and ensured system availability and reliability.
  • Monitoring system resource utilization, trending, and capacity planning.
  • Managing and configuring Network devices via SNMP via RMM tools e.g., N-Central N-

able, ConnectWise, PRTG etc.

  • Exposure with popular tools to troubleshoot the complex issues in Networks e.g., PSping,

Telnet, traceroute, network watcher, Wireshark, Fidler etc.

  • Providing Level 2 support and troubleshooting to resolve issues.
  • Working within established configuration and change management policies to ensure

awareness, approval and success of changes made to the network infrastructure.

  • Responsible to Create SOPs for Different solutions to help Tier 1 and Tier 2 Team members.
  • Will be responsible for updating, sharing daily, weekly & monthly tickets tracker &

analysis.

  • Defining key management routines and governance strategy to ensure effective

business process execution.

  • Initiate improvements in tools, requirements gathering, processes, and people.

Knowledge and Skills

Educational Qualifications:

  • Should be Graduate or Above.
  • Certifications desirable – CCNP, PCNSE, Check Point certified

Work Experience:

  • Should have worked as a Senior Network Engineer Level 3 and understand design aspects
  • Should at least have 7 to 12 years of total working experience in related field.

Other Prerequisites:

  • Ability to work is rotational shift & depending on business needs.
  • Prior work experience in MNC & matrix organization.

Preferred candidate profile



Perks and benefits

title: IT Infrastructure Head (Projects and Patching) - Banking
tagsAndSkills: new office infrastructure,Patch Management,Vulnerability management,IT Infrastructure Management,Project Experience,It Compliance,Budget Experience,Patching
jobDescription:
Job Description: IT Infrastructure Projects and Patching Head


Location : Navi Mumbai


Job Summary: The IT Infrastructure Projects and Patching Head is responsible for overseeing the planning and implementation of IT Infrastructure Projects and the patch management processes. This role ensures that IT projects are completed on time, within budget, and in alignment with business objectives.


Additionally, the role is responsible for ensuring that all systems and applications are up-to-date with the latest patches and updates to mitigate security risks and maintain operational efficiency.


Key Responsibilities:


IT Infrastructure Management: • Lead the design, implementation, and maintenance of the organization's IT infrastructure, including servers, networks, storage, and data centers. • Ensure high availability, scalability, and reliability of IT infrastructure to support business operations. • Micro-segmentation, SD WAN Rollouts, ensuring quality of service, NAC, DAM, Netscope management. • Oversee the management of cloud infrastructure and services


Project Management: • Plan, execute, and monitor IT infrastructure projects like application roll outs, BAU updates, New branch roll out etc. from initiation to completion. • Develop project plans, timelines, and budgets, and ensure adherence to project management best practices. • Coordinate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and vendors to ensure successful project delivery. • Identify and mitigate project risks and issues.


Patching and Update Management: • Develop and implement a comprehensive patch management strategy for all IT systems and applications. • Ensure timely and efficient deployment of patches and updates to mitigate security vulnerabilities and enhance system performance. • Monitor and report on patch compliance and effectiveness. • Collaborate with the information security team to address any identified vulnerabilities



Compliance: • Maintain key IT Infra Policies and Compliances • Manage regulatory reporting and facing internal and external audits. • EOL/EOS management for physical devices, OS middleware and database.


Team Leadership and Development: • Lead and manage a team of IT professionals, including system administrators, network engineers, and project managers. • Provide mentorship, training, and performance evaluation

title: Lead Angular Web Developer
jobDescription:
Were seeking a Lead Web Developer to optimize our application performance as well as implement and maintain complex domain logic. This role will collaborate closely with Engineering and internal teams, design and implement Angular modules, components, services, directives, as well as deliver high performing, scalable, fault-tolerant digital experiences to millions of users. The Lead Web Developer at Hathway is an exceptional and experienced software engineer with technical leadership ability. This position reports directly to the VP of Web Engineering and works closely with the Engineering team.
 
WHAT YOULL DO HERE
 
Program software solutions in accordance with business requirements
Design, develop, test, and deploy software solutions to maintain and improve Hathway software products
Participate in product strategy, design, and product discussions with internal teams to determine how to deliver the best experience for users
Communicate codebase capabilities and constraints to the product team to ensure requirements map to codebase capabilities
Engage in knowledge sharing opportunities for the engineering team
Collaborate with Engineering and internal teams to deliver a best-in-class customer experience for Hathway brands
Connect with the software development community and track latest trends and emerging technologies
Evaluate and recommend tools, technologies, and processes to help ensure a high-quality, maintainable codebase
Mentor junior developers on software development techniques, standards, and best practices
Cultivate innovation by driving collaborative development of software features across multiple projects
Capture and share best-practice knowledge and domain expertise for software architecture & engineering
Perform technical discovery for new business logic capabilities that must be built into the codebase, and work with the product team to ensure requirements match with the capabilities of existing and new integrations with third-party platforms and services
Develop web applications with an emphasis on front-end/presentation layer and domain logic; work with project teams to deliver the required features and functionality within the digital experiences
Maintain and expand the front-end/presentation layer and domain logic so features and functionality can continue to be shared across all of Hathway client deployments
 
YOUR BACKGROUND
 
Bachelors degree in Computer Science/Engineering or a related technical field, or relevant experience in computer software engineering
7+ years of experience writing code in an object oriented language and/or web frontend framework and developing automated tests
Extensive knowledge of JavaScript (ES6), web stacks, libraries, and frameworks, specifically Angular (preferably Angular 6+), Node.js , Typescript. Experience with the Ionic framework is a bonus.
Demonstrated understanding of web development protocols and front-end technologies: HTML5, CSS3, SCSS/SASS/LESS, JSON, XML
Experience working with third-party developer tools such as Swagger, Cyprus, Git/Github, Docker, etc.
Experience developing scalable systems and codebases, and developing testable, reusable, and efficient code without the explicit directive to do so
Experience working with two or more from the following: web application development, Ionic application development, server-side applications, high load/high traffic user-facing web applications, cloud technologies, Unix/Linux environments
Excellent problem-solving skills
Strong technical communication skills as well as proficiency communicating technical concepts and solutions to non-technical audiences
Must be able to effectively lead projects
Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks across multiple projects
